title: Mark Lambert (rugby union)
text:
Mark Lambert (born 19 February 1985 in <a href="London">London</a>) is a former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> in the <a href="Premiership%20Rugby">Gallagher Premiership</a>. He played as a <a href="Prop%20%28rugby%20union%29">Prop</a>.
Lambert represented England at U19 and U21 level. He made his debut for the <a href="England%20Saxons">England Saxons</a> against the <a href="Argentina%20Jaguars">Argentina Jaguars</a> at the <a href="2009%20Churchill%20Cup">2009 Churchill Cup</a>.
He was a replacement for Harlequins in their <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20English%20Premiership%20%28rugby%20union%29">2011–12 Premiership</a> final victory over <a href="Leicester%20Tigers">Leicester Tigers</a>.
In November 2017, he was elected as the chairman of the <a href="Rugby%20Players%27%20Association">Rugby Players' Association</a>
He holds the rather auspicious record of being the player most used as a substitute in Gallagher Premiership history.
He announced his retirement in June 2020.
